sentences.english: I asked myself, in an isolated corner of the campus.
sentences.chinese: 我一遍又遍地詰問自己，在校園孤零的一角。

sentences.english: The witness was cross-examined by the defending counsel.
sentences.chinese: 證人受到辯護律師的詰問。

sentences.english: The witness remained collected throughout the cross-examination.
sentences.chinese: 證人在整個反詰問過程中保持着鎮靜自若。

sentences.english: The spokesman was completely discombobulated by the hecklers.
sentences.chinese: 發言人完全被詰問者擾亂了。

sentences.english: Sandberg says they asked each other, “What do you believe?
sentences.chinese: 桑德伯格說他們互相詰問對方，“你相信什麼？

sentences.english: The Socialist candidate was heckled continuously.
sentences.chinese: 社會黨候選人不斷受到詰問。

sentences.english: The reproached coach unloaded the loaves to the approachable roadside.
sentences.chinese: 受到詰問詰責的教練把麪包卸到可接近的路旁。

sentences.english: The prosecution lawyer cross-examined the defence witness.
sentences.chinese: 控方律師詰問被告一方的證人。

sentences.english: No matter how the reporters heckled him the speaker always had an answer to come back with.
sentences.chinese: 不論記者如何詰問，發言人總能對答如流。

definition: lit. to share the same bed with different dreams (idiom); ostensible partners with different agendas/strange bedfellows/marital dissension
to rely on/to base oneself on
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
